name: Blackleg
information: Blackleg is an acute, infectious disease caused by Clostridium chauvoei bacteria. It primarily affects young cattle between 6 months and 2 years of age.
symptoms: Swelling of muscles in legs, shoulders, chest
Hot and painful swellings that become cold and painless
Crackling sound when pressing affected areas
remedies: Treatment is usually ineffective due to rapid progression
Early antibiotic treatment might help in some cases
Supportive care and isolation of affected animals
Proper disposal of carcasses to prevent spread

causes.main: Infection by Clostridium chauvoei bacteria, which can lie dormant in soil for years
specific_causes: Ingestion of bacterial spores from contaminated soil
Injury or bruising that activates dormant spores in muscle tissue
High protein diets in young cattle

prevention: Vaccination of calves at 4-6 months of age
